title: Roast beetroot houmous with feta and pumpkin seeds

ingredients.item: 2 tbsp pumpkin seeds, toasted in a dry pan
big pinch fresh herbs (coriander, mint, parsley, dill or a mixture), roughly chopped

instructions.step: Preheat the oven to 200˚C, gas mark 6. Scrub the beets well and wrap loosely in foil (there’s no need to dry them first). Place on a baking tray in the middle of the oven and roast for about 1 hour. Meanwhile, drain the chick peas, reserving the liquid in a jug and chilling it in the fridge.

The beets are done when a knife slides easily into the centre. Set aside to cool slightly, and when cool enough to handle, put a pair of clean rubber gloves on and rub the skins off. Chop the beets up roughly and put in a food processor.

Add the rest of the houmous ingredients, along with 2 tbsp of the chilled chick pea liquid and whizz until totally smooth, drizzling in more chick pea liquid, a little at a time, until the houmous is the perfect consistency to dip into (about another 1-3 tbsp usually does the trick).

Taste and adjust the seasoning, adding more salt, lemon juice or tahini, if liked. Spoon into a serving bowl and garnish with the crumbled feta, toasted seeds and herbs. Serve the toasted pitta on the side.
